intro: Parosela calocalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered parosela, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes various bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white, bell-like flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture.
